triples.name: Deep reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The survey provides a comprehensive overview of DRL, which combines deep learning with reinforcement learning for end-to-end control.

triples.name: Deep learning
triples.relevance: DRL integrates the feature representation ability of deep learning, making it a fundamental component of deep reinforcement learning.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: DRL combines reinforcement learning's decision-making ability with deep learning for optimal control in high-dimensional environments.

triples.name: Hierarchical reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The survey discusses HRL as a key subfield developed by deep learning, enabling decomposition of complex learning problems into manageable sub-problems.

triples.name: Multi-agent reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The survey covers multiagent reinforcement learning as an important research domain where multiple learning agents interact in shared environments.

triples.name: Imitation learning
triples.relevance: The survey discusses imitation learning as a subfield developed by DRL, where agents learn from expert demonstrations.

triples.name: Q-learning
triples.relevance: Q-learning is a fundamental value-based DRL algorithm discussed in the survey for learning action values without requiring an environment model.

triples.name: Policy gradient method
triples.relevance: Policy gradient methods are key policy-based DRL algorithms covered in the survey that directly optimize the policy function.

triples.name: Maximum entropy
triples.relevance: The survey discusses maximum entropy-based DRL approaches as an important advancement that balances exploration and exploitation.
